Possible to graduate

Source: vignettes/grad6_possible.Rmd
grad6_possible.Rmd

Introduction

Students for whom graduation in 6 years is not possible must be excluded from the counts used in many persistence metrics. We refer to this as the “possible to graduate in 6 years” condition (or pos-grad-6 for short).

For example, suppose a first-time-in-college, first-year student starts in the Fall of 2010. If 2011 were the last term for which we have data from that institution, then the student’s graduation status cannot be known. It follows that this student must be excluded from a count of non-graduates if that count affects the persistence metric, e.g., graduation rate.

Care must be taken, then, in the first 6-year span and in the final 6-year span of an institution’s data to exclude students for whom pos-grad-6 is false. And different institutions have provided data over different spans of years.

Examine the data

suppressPackageStartupMessages(library(tidyverse))
library(midfielddata)
library(midfieldr)

We want midfieldstudents for their starting term and transfer status; `midfieldterms for their first and last recorded terms, standing, and level; and midfielddegrees for the term they are awarded a degree if any.

students <- midfieldstudents %>% 
    select(id, institution, term_enter, transfer)

terms <- midfieldterms %>% 
    select(id, institution, term, level, standing)

degrees <- midfielddegrees %>% 
    select(id, institution, term_degree)

Review

Using terms, find the min and max terms in the data for each institution

options(tibble.print_min = 12L)
this_group <- group_by(terms, institution)
inst_span  <- summarize(
    this_group, 
    inst_min = min(term), 
    inst_max = max(term)
    ) %>% 
    arrange(inst_min)

inst_span
#> # A tibble: 12 x 3
#>    institution   inst_min inst_max
#>    <chr>            <dbl>    <dbl>
#>  1 Institution A    19871    20034
#>  2 Institution K    19871    20034
#>  3 Institution B       NA       NA
#>  4 Institution C       NA       NA
#>  5 Institution D       NA       NA
#>  6 Institution E       NA       NA
#>  7 Institution F       NA       NA
#>  8 Institution G       NA       NA
#>  9 Institution H       NA       NA
#> 10 Institution J       NA       NA
#> 11 Institution L       NA       NA
#> 12 Institution M       NA       NA

For the 6-year span at the end of an institution’s data span, all graduates can be counted—the non-graduates must be chacked for pos-grad-6.

Separate grads from non-grads.

pos_grad6_id <- degrees %>% 
    filter(!is.na(term_degree)) %>% 
    select(id)

non_grads <- degrees %>% 
    filter(is.na(term_degree)) %>% 
    unique()

Confim that the student IDs are unique.

glimpse(pos_grad6_id)
#> Observations: 47,499
#> Variables: 1
#> $ id <chr> "MID25783162", "MID25783178", "MID25783188", "MID25783195",...
length(unique(pos_grad6_id$id))
#> [1] 47499

glimpse(non_grads)
#> Observations: 50,141
#> Variables: 3
#> $ id          <chr> "MID25783135", "MID25783147", "MID25783156", "MID2...
#> $ institution <chr> "Institution M", "Institution M", "Institution M",...
#> $ term_degree <dbl> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA...
length(unique(non_grads$id))
#> [1] 50141

Join the student’s entering term and transfer status and the institution’s last term with the non-grads.

non_grads <- non_grads %>% 
    left_join(., students, by = c("id", "institution")) %>% 
    left_join(., inst_span, by = "institution") %>% 
    select(id, institution, transfer, inst_max, term_enter) %>% 
    mutate(delta = inst_max - term_enter)

non_grads
#> # A tibble: 50,141 x 6
#>    id          institution   transfer inst_max term_enter delta
#>    <chr>       <chr>         <chr>       <dbl>      <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1 MID25783135 Institution M N              NA      19911    NA
#>  2 MID25783147 Institution M N              NA      20041    NA
#>  3 MID25783156 Institution M N              NA      20011    NA

sort(unique(non_grads$delta))
#>  [1]   0   1   3  10  11  13  20  21  23  30  31  33  40  41  43  50  51
#> [18]  53  60  61  63  70  71  73  80  81  83  90  91  93 100 101 103 110
#> [35] 111 113 120 121 123 130 131 133 140 141 143 150 151 153 160 161 163

If the \(\Delta \geq 60\) then clearly it was possible for a student to graduate in 6 years. Add the keepers to the pos-grad-6 set of IDs.

keepers <- non_grads %>% 
    filter(delta >= 60) %>% 
    select(id) 

pos_grad6_id <- bind_rows(pos_grad6_id, keepers)
glimpse(pos_grad6_id)
#> Observations: 50,875
#> Variables: 1
#> $ id <chr> "MID25783162", "MID25783178", "MID25783188", "MID25783195",...

The group of non-grads that remains needs further study

study_group <- non_grads %>% 
        filter(delta < 60)

study_group
#> # A tibble: 4,753 x 6
#>    id          institution   transfer inst_max term_enter delta
#>    <chr>       <chr>         <chr>       <dbl>      <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1 MID26131491 Institution A Y           20034      20021    13
#>  2 MID26131493 Institution A N           20034      20021    13
#>  3 MID26131501 Institution A N           20034      20013    21

#>  5 MID26131511 Institution A N           20034      20011    23

#> 11 MID26131975 Institution K N           20034      19991    43
#> 12 MID26132017 Institution K N           20034      20023    11
#> # ... with 4,741 more rows

Let’s start by separating transfers and non-transfers. Non-transfers with \(\Delta < 60\) will be assumed to not satisfy pos-grad-6. Their IDs will be exclkuded from further analysis.

non_transfer <- study_group %>% 
    filter(transfer == "N")

exclude_id <- non_transfer
exclude_id
#> # A tibble: 4,356 x 6
#>    id          institution   transfer inst_max term_enter delta
#>    <chr>       <chr>         <chr>       <dbl>      <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1 MID26131493 Institution A N           20034      20021    13
#>  2 MID26131501 Institution A N           20034      20013    21
#>  3 MID26131502 Institution A N           20034      20011    23
#>  4 MID26131511 Institution A N           20034      20011    23
#>  5 MID26131528 Institution A N           20034      20003    31
#>  6 MID26131544 Institution A N           20034      19981    53
#>  7 MID26131965 Institution K N           20034      19983    51
#>  8 MID26131974 Institution K N           20034      19984    50
#>  9 MID26131975 Institution K N           20034      19991    43
#> 10 MID26132017 Institution K N           20034      20023    11
#> 11 MID26132023 Institution K N           20034      19991    43
#> 12 MID26132034 Institution A N           20034      20011    23
#> # ... with 4,344 more rows

For the transfer students, the length of time from their entering term to the last term in the institution data depends on their entering status. Join level and standing from terms data.

transfer <- study_group %>% 
    filter(transfer == "Y") %>% 
    left_join(., terms, by = c("id", "institution")) %>% 
    select(id, delta, term_enter, term, level, standing) 

transfer
#> # A tibble: 1,524 x 6
#>    id          delta term_enter  term level        standing             
#>    <chr>       <dbl>      <dbl> <dbl> <chr>        <chr>                
#>  1 MID26131491    13      20021 20021 01 Freshman  First Time in College
#>  2 MID26131523    23      20011 20011 01 Freshman  First Time in College
#>  3 MID26132316    13      20021 20021 01 Freshman  First Time in College
#>  4 MID26132316    13      20021 20023 01 Freshman  Good Standing        
#>  5 MID26132316    13      20021 20024 02 Sophomore Good Standing        
#>  6 MID26132316    13      20021 20031 02 Sophomore Good Standing        
#>  7 MID26132316    13      20021 20033 02 Sophomore Good Standing        
#>  8 MID26132732    11      20023 20023 01 Freshman  First Time in College
#>  9 MID26132732    11      20023 20031 01 Freshman  Good Standing        
#> 10 MID26132732    11      20023 20033 01 Freshman  Good Standing        
#> 11 MID26132732    11      20023 20034 01 Freshman  Good Standing        
#> 12 MID26133559    13      20021 20021 01 Freshman  First Time in College
#> # ... with 1,512 more rows

Transfers meeting any of these criteria satisfy the pos-grad-6 condition.

  • level is Freshman and \(\Delta >= 55\)
  • level is Sophomore and \(\Delta >= 45\)
  • level is Junior and \(\Delta >= 35\)
  • level is Senior and \(\Delta >= 25\) 
keepers <- transfer %>% 
    filter((level == "Freshman"   & delta > 50) | 
                    (level == "Sophomore" & delta > 40) |
                    (level == "Junior"    & delta > 30) |
                    (level == "Senior"    & delta > 20)
                 )

keepers
#> # A tibble: 0 x 6
#> # ... with 6 variables: id <chr>, delta <dbl>, term_enter <dbl>,
#> #   term <dbl>, level <chr>, standing <chr>

Issue bin

By institution, last term_enter that a student could matriculate and have 6 years’ worth of data:

  • Institution A, Institution E, Institution K, Institution H – 19981
  • Institution F, Institution G – 19991
  • Institution B, Institution M, Institution J – 20041
  • Institution C, Institution D – 20101
  • Institution L – 20111
